spmidi_jukebox.h File Reference

Tools for playing from a selection of songs. More...

#include "spmidi.h"

Detailed Description

Tools for playing from a selection of songs.

Author:
Phil Burk, Copyright 2004 Mobileer, PROPRIETARY and CONFIDENTIAL

Define Documentation

#define JUKEBOX_INVALID_SONG_ID   (-1)
 

#define JUKEBOX_LOOP_FOREVER   (0)
 

#define JUKEBOX_MAX_LOOPS   (250)
 

Function Documentation

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_AllNotesOff (  int  time,
int  channel
) 
 

Turn off all notes on the given channel.

Parameters:
time in ticks when event should occur
channel Index of the MIDI channel ranging from 0 to 15. Not 1 to 16!

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_ClearCommands (  void   ) 
 

Remove any events in the command event buffer.

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_ClearSongQueue (  void   ) 
 

Remove any songs currently in the queue.

You may need to call this if you want to start a song immediately.

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_ControlChange (  int  time,
int  channel,
int  controller,
int  value
) 
 

Change a controller value for a channel.

Parameters:
time in ticks when event should occur
channel Index of the MIDI channel ranging from 0 to 15. Not 1 to 16!
controller Controller index from 0 to 127. 7 is volume control.
value Controller value from 0 to 127.

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_EnableChannel (  int  channel,
int  onOrOff
) 
 

Enable or disable a MIDI channel.

This will affect both Songs and MIDI commands.

Parameters:
channel Index of the MIDI channel ranging from 0 to 15. Not 1 to 16!
onOrOff 1 for on and 0 for off

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_EnableSongTrack (  int  songID,
int  trackIndex,
int  onOrOff
) 
 

Enable or disable a track on the song.

Note that in a format one type MIDI file that track zero is usually a tempo map.

Parameters:
songID between zero and (JukeBox_GetNumSongs()-1)
trackIndex 
onOrOff 1 for on and 0 for off

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_FinishSong (  void   ) 
 

Finish the current song at the end of the current loop.

int JukeBox_GetCurrentSongID (  void   ) 
 

Returns:
ID of the currently playing song or JUKEBOX_INVALID_SONG_ID if none playing.

int JukeBox_GetFramesPerTick (  void   ) 
 

The tick rate is the framesPerSecond / framesPerTick.

Remember divides are expensive.

Returns:
number of audio frames in a tick

int JukeBox_GetMaxVoices (  void   ) 
 

Returns:
current maximum number of instruments that can be played simultaneously.

SPMIDI_Context* JukeBox_GetMIDIContext (  void   ) 
 

Warning: do not use this context while another thread is calling any SPMIDI routines including JukeBox_SynthesizeAudio.

Returns:
SPMIDI_Context used by JukeBox.

int JukeBox_GetNumSongs (  void   ) 
 

Returns:
number of songs available to be played.

int JukeBox_GetSongQueueDepth (  void   ) 
 

Returns:
number of songs in the queue

int JukeBox_GetTime (  void   ) 
 

Return the current time of the JukeBox engine.

Here is an example of scheduling an event 1/2 second in the future: 


   int time = JukeBox_GetTime();
   // Only do this calculation once.
   int ticksPerSecond = sampleRate / JukeBox_GetFramesPerTick();
   int delay = ticksPerSecond / 2;
   JukeBox_NoteOn( time+delay, 0, 60, 64 );
Returns:
current time in ticks

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_Initialize (  int  sampleRate  ) 
 

Initialize ME2000 engine and song playlist based on custom include files.

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_MIDICommand (  int  time,
int  cmd,
int  d1,
int  d2
) 
 

Send arbitrary MIDI command If specified command takes less than 2 data bytes, the additional data will be ignored.

Parameters:
time in ticks when event should occur
cmd MIDI command byte
d1 First data byte
d2 Second data byte

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_NoteOff (  int  time,
int  channel,
int  pitch,
int  velocity
) 
 

Turn off a note.

Equivalent to lifting a key on a keyboard. The note will continue to sound for a short time.

Parameters:
time in ticks when event should occur
channel Index of the MIDI channel ranging from 0 to 15. Not 1 to 16!
pitch Pitch index ranging from 0 to 127. Middle C is 60.
velocity Loudness control ranging from 0 to 127. Typically 0.

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_NoteOn (  int  time,
int  channel,
int  pitch,
int  velocity
) 
 

Turn on a note.

Parameters:
time in ticks when event should occur
channel Index of the MIDI channel ranging from 0 to 15. Not 1 to 16!
pitch Pitch index ranging from 0 to 127. Middle C is 60.
velocity Loudness control ranging from 0 to 127. Typically 64.

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_PauseSong (  void   ) 
 

Pause the current song.

Turns off any notes currently on.

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_PitchBend (  int  time,
int  channel,
int  bend
) 
 

Change the pitch of all the notes on a channel.

Parameters:
time in ticks when event should occur
channel Index of the MIDI channel ranging from 0 to 15. Not 1 to 16!
bend A 14 bit unsigned pitchbend value. Value for no bend is MIDI_BEND_NONE.

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_ProgramChange (  int  time,
int  channel,
int  program
) 
 

Change the program (instrument) on the given MIDI channel.

Parameters:
time in ticks when event should occur
channel Index of the MIDI channel ranging from 0 to 15. Not 1 to 16!
program Instrument index ranging from 0 to 127. Not 1 to 128!

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_QueueSong (  int  songID,
int  numLoops
) 
 

Add the selected song to the queue.

The index will be determined by a header file exported by the Mobileer Editor.

Parameters:
songID between zero and (JukeBox_GetNumSongs()-1)
numLoops number of times to repeat entire song. Use JUKEBOX_LOOP_FOREVER for endless repetition.

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_ResumeSong (  void   ) 
 

Resume the current song.

No effect if not paused.

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_SendMIDI (  int  time,
int  numBytes,
unsigned char  bytes[]
) 
 

Send MIDI byte to the synthesizer through the command FIFO.

This can be used to build arbitrary MIDI commands

Parameters:
time in ticks when event should occur
bytes MIDI protocol command or data ranging from 0 to 255

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_SetBendRange (  int  time,
int  channel,
int  semitones,
int  cents
) 
 

Set maximum pitch bend range a channel.

Parameters:
time in ticks when event should occur
channel Index of the MIDI channel ranging from 0 to 15. Not 1 to 16!
semitones Pitch offset for maximum pitch bend from 0 to 12.
cents Fractional offset from 0 to 99.

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_SetMaxVoices (  int  maxVoices  ) 
 

Set the maximum number of instruments that can be played simultaneously.

A typical major chord, for example, would take three voices.

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_SetVolume (  int  volume  ) 
 

Set overall audio volume.

Parameters:
volume default is 128, zero for silence

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_StopSong (  void   ) 
 

Immediately stop the current song.

Notes will be allowed to decay naturally to silence.

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_StopSound (  void   ) 
 

Stop all sound output as quickly as possible without causing a click.

To make sure there is not a click when shutting down, call JukeBox_SynthesizeAudio() with at least 256 frames between calling this and JukeBox_Terminate(). Resets all controllers.

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_SynthesizeAudioTick (  short *  buffer,
int  maxFrames,
int  channelsPerFrame
) 
 

Generate one tick worth of audio and write it to the buffer for playback.

The synthesized audio must fit into the maximum This may be called by an interrupt or separate Thread. All other functions must be called from the same thread or be protected using semaphores to prevent thread collisions.

Parameters:
maxFrames is the max number of mono or stereo groups of samples that can fit in the buffer
channelsPerFrame is 1 for mono and 2 for stereo
Returns:
number of frames synthesized

SPMIDI_Error JukeBox_Terminate (  void   )
